sen.j: 観音寺（かんのんじ）は、京都市東山区泉涌寺山内にある真言宗泉涌寺派の寺院。
sen.e: Kannonji Temple is a temple of Shingon sect Sennyu-ji school, which is located in Sennyuji Yamanouchi, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
Kannonji Temple, located in Sennyuji Yamanouchi, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, is a temple of the Shingon sect's Sennyu-ji school.
Kannon-ji Temple, located in Sennyuji Yamanouchi, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, is a temple of the Shingon sect's Sennyu-ji school.

sen.j: 泉涌寺の塔頭のひとつで、今熊野観音寺（いまくまのかんのんじ）とも称される。
sen.e: It is one of the tatchu (sub-temples in the site of main temple) of Sennyu-ji Temple and also called Imakumano Kannon-ji Temple.
It is one of the tatchu (sub-temples on the site of a main temple) of Sennyu-ji Temple and is also called Imakumano Kannon-ji Temple.
It is one of the tatchu (sub-temples on the site of a main temple) of Sennyu-ji Temple and is also called Imakumano Kannon-ji Temple.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Shinnachizan.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Shinnachizan.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Shinnachizan.

sen.j: 本尊は十一面観音（秘仏）。
sen.e: Its honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Eleven-faced Kannon (Goddess of Mercy) (A Buddhist image normally withheld from public view).
Its honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Eleven-Faced Kannon (Goddess of Mercy) (a Buddhist image normally withheld from public view).
Its honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Eleven-Faced Kannon (Goddess of Mercy) (a Buddhist image normally withheld from public view).
History
History
History

sen.j: 大同 (日本)年間（806年～810年）空海が庵を結んだのに始まるとされ、藤原緒嗣が伽藍を造営したと伝えられる。
sen.e: It is said to have started when Kukai built a hermitage and FUJIWARA no Otsugu built a Buddhist temple during Daido era (806 - 810).
sen.cmt: 「庵を結ぶ」という意味が不明ですが、「庵を建てる」と致しました。
sen.e: It is said to have started during the Daido era (806 - 810), when Kukai built a hermitage and FUJIWARA no Otsugu built a Buddhist temple.
It is said to have started during the Daido era (806 - 810), when Kukai built a hermitage and FUJIWARA no Otsugu built a Buddhist temple.

sen.j: 永暦年間（1331年～1334年）新熊野神社が建てられるとその本地仏を祀る寺とされた。
sen.e: As Imakumano-jinja Shrine was built during Eiryaku era (1331 - 1334), it became a temple to honor its honji-butsu (original Buddhist divinity).
Because Imakumano-jinja Shrine was built during the Eiryaku era (1331 - 1334), it became a temple to honor its honji-butsu (original Buddhist divinity).
Because Imakumano-jinja Shrine was built during the Eiryaku era (1331 - 1334), it became a temple to honor its honji-butsu (original Buddhist divinity).
